symptoms: Anaphylaxis, difficulty breathing, swelling of face and throat, hives, rapid pulse
ingredients: Peanut oil, peanut flour, peanut butter, groundnuts, arachis oil, mixed nuts
notes: Carry EpiPen at all times. Avoid all products processed in facilities that handle peanuts.

symptoms: Anaphylaxis, swelling, difficulty breathing, skin reactions
ingredients: Almonds, walnuts, pecans, cashews, pistachios, brazil nuts, hazelnuts, macadamia nuts
notes: Different tree nuts may cause different severities. Some people allergic to only specific nuts.

symptoms: Hives, swelling, gastrointestinal problems, respiratory issues
ingredients: Salmon, tuna, cod, halibut, anchovies, fish sauce, worcestershire sauce
notes: May be allergic to specific types of fish only. Cross-contamination risk in restaurants.

ingredients: Snails, clams, oysters, squid, octopus, scallops
notes: Common in Mediterranean diets. Not always labeled.

symptoms: Anaphylaxis, hives, difficulty breathing, gastrointestinal symptoms
ingredients: Sesame seeds, tahini, sesame oil, hummus, halva, some bread toppings
notes: Increasingly recognized allergen. Now required to be labeled in many countries.

symptoms: Hives, vomiting, difficulty swallowing, abdominal pain, dizziness
ingredients: Shrimp, crab, lobster, crawfish, mollusks, oysters, clams, mussels
notes: Cross-contamination risk high in seafood restaurants. Often develops in adulthood.

ingredients: Almonds, marzipan, almond milk, nut mixes

symptoms: Oral allergy syndrome, anaphylaxis, skin reactions
ingredients: Celery root, celery salt, celery stalks, soups, spice mixes
notes: Common in Europe. Can cause severe reactions.

symptoms: Skin rash, stomach upset, respiratory problems, runny nose
ingredients: Albumin, egg whites, egg yolks, mayonnaise, meringue, custard, lecithin
notes: Often outgrown by adolescence. Some people can tolerate baked eggs but not raw.

symptoms: Itchy mouth, hives, oral allergy syndrome
notes: Tree nut. Cross-reacts with birch pollen.

ingredients: Lupin flour, lupin beans, gluten-free products
notes: Legume family. Increasingly used in gluten-free foods.

symptoms: Stomach pain, bloating, diarrhea, nausea, gas
ingredients: Lactose, casein, whey, butter, cream, cheese, yogurt, milk powder
notes: Lactose-free alternatives available. Severity varies with amount consumed.

ingredients: Mustard seeds, mustard powder, prepared mustard, salad dressings
notes: Common in Europe and Canada. Can cause severe reactions.

symptoms: Digestive issues, skin problems, respiratory symptoms, headache
ingredients: Wheat flour, gluten, bread, pasta, cereals, crackers, beer
notes: Different from celiac disease. May be able to tolerate other grains like rice and corn.

symptoms: Itchy mouth, throat, mild swelling, oral allergy syndrome
ingredients: Raw apples, apple juice, cider, apple sauce
notes: Often related to birch pollen allergy. Cooked apples usually tolerated.

symptoms: Itchy mouth, swelling, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome
notes: Latex-fruit syndrome. Cross-reacts with banana and chestnut.

symptoms: Itchy mouth, swelling lips, oral allergy syndrome
notes: Latex-fruit syndrome possible. Related to birch pollen.

symptoms: Hives, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome

ingredients: Kidney beans, black beans, pinto beans, baked beans

symptoms: Hives, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome
Hives, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome

notes: Common in Asia. Not related to wheat.

symptoms: Itchy mouth, swelling, oral allergy syndrome
ingredients: Fresh cherry, cherry pie, cherry juice
notes: Rosaceae family. Cross-reacts with birch pollen.

symptoms: Hives, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome
ingredients: Chicken meat, chicken broth, processed foods
Coconut milk, coconut oil, shredded coconut
notes: Tree nut family but rarely cross-reacts.

ingredients: Corn syrup, corn starch, popcorn, tortillas, polenta
notes: Often mild. Corn is in many processed foods.

ingredients: Garlic powder, fresh garlic, sauces, dressings
notes: Can be severe. Common in Mediterranean and Asian cuisine.

symptoms: Hives, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome
Hives, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome
notes: Rare but possible. Sulfites in wine may worsen symptoms.

symptoms: Tingling mouth, swelling, hives, oral allergy syndrome
notes: Common in children. May cross-react with latex.
Legume family. Common in Mediterranean and Indian diets.

symptoms: Itchy mouth, swelling, hives, oral allergy syndrome
notes: Related to poison ivy family. Skin contact may cause rash.

symptoms: Itchy mouth, swelling, oral allergy syndrome
Hives, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome
Hives, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome
Stomach upset, hives, oral allergy syndrome
ingredients: Raw onion, onion powder, soups, salads
notes: Often mild. Related to pollen allergies.

ingredients: Green peas, pea protein, split peas
notes: Legume family. Increasing in vegan foods.

symptoms: Itchy mouth, swelling, oral allergy syndrome
ingredients: Fresh peach, canned peach, peach yogurt
notes: Rosaceae family. Cross-reacts with birch pollen.

ingredients: Fresh pear, canned pear, pear juice

symptoms: Mouth tingling, swelling, hives, digestive upset
ingredients: Fresh pineapple, pineapple juice, fruit salads

symptoms: Hives, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome
Itchy mouth, hives, oral allergy syndrome
ingredients: Raw potato, potato chips, mashed potatoes
notes: Nightshade family. Cooked potatoes usually tolerated.

symptoms: Hives, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome
Itchy mouth, hives, oral allergy syndrome
Hives, stomach upset, oral allergy syndrome
Mild stomach upset, skin irritation, runny nose
ingredients: Soy sauce, tofu, tempeh, soy milk, soy protein, edamame, miso
notes: Common in processed foods. Often mild reactions. Check labels carefully.

symptoms: Oral allergy syndrome, mild hives, itchy mouth and throat
ingredients: Fresh strawberries, strawberry flavoring, strawberry jam, smoothies
notes: Often part of oral allergy syndrome. May be related to birch pollen allergy.

symptoms: Itchy mouth, hives, swelling, oral allergy syndrome
ingredients: Raw tomatoes, tomato sauce, ketchup, pizza
notes: Nightshade family. May cross-react with grass pollen.
